result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather L Escobio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
63 days jail credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 1 in Dunn County case 20CM153.

miscConds.notes:
Follow recommendations of agent.
Must submit a DNA sample.
PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED WILL BE APPLIED

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Defendant Heather L Escobio in court in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appeared by video for Heather L Escobio.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
18CF191, 20CM153, 20CT74, 22CF242, 22FO635

Atty Tomtschik - plea documents have been efiled. Plea to Ct 1 20CM153 and Ct 2 22CF242. Both would be misd

State - 20CT74 will be DRI. 9 months jail on 18CF191. Other cases are 12 month probation concurrent.  No contact with any Kwik Trip in Menomonie. Follow recommendations of agent. Restitution $169.66 in 20CM153 . costs of $463.00 on Ct 2 22CF242. $443 costs on 20CM153. Victim rights have been complied with.

Court - will not need to waive prelim as DE will plea to misd.  Provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters Guilty plea 22CF242 on Count 2. Enters Guilty plea to 20CM153 on Count 1.
Parties stipulate to the facts
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty.
State - asks court to accept joint agreement.
Atty Tomtschik - agrees court should accept joint agreement.
DE - makes a statement

Court orders -

9 months jail
81 days jail credit
Huber granted if eligible

withheld sentence
12 months probation
Concurrent to Ct 1 of 20CM153

withheld sentence
12 months probation
Concurrent to Ct 2 of 22CF242
